task.title: Provide Your Own Dataset
task.shortdesc: Upload your own dataset to HuViz.

copyright.copyrholder: Use of this public-domain resource is governed by the Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial 4.0 International License

taskbody.context: You can load your own ontology and/or dataset to HuViz. External files need to be in Turtle (.ttl) format. There are two ways to upload your data: 1) local file or 2) URL. All files must be in ttl format.

step.cmd: A new option will appear, asking you to "Drop File or URL."

choices.choice: Copy and past the file URL into the window.
OR open the file in your desktop finder. Drag and drop the file into the window.

step.stepresult: Once you drag the correct file type (.ttl) to the box, it will light up green.

substep.cmd: Choose a pre-loaded ontology from the dropdown menu.
OR scroll down to "Provide New Ontology" to load your own ontology.
substep.info: Just like with a dataset you can upload your own ontology via local file or URL.

step.stepresult: Once you have chosen a dataset and an ontology, the "Load" button will appear.
